unit.utterance_translation: OK, good.
Hello.
OK, I want to tell a story.
The war came and we ran away

unit.utterance: war palumdo ngamsole main ngau aipain haun
unit.utterance_translation: War came and we young girls ran away.
No breasts.
We were in school and the Japanese came
They closed our road.

unit.utterance: do ngau windolo ngahahaiye main numau maluse main
unit.utterance_translation: I jumped out of the window and broke my hand.
I jumped down out of the window.
And we ran away into the jungle.

unit.utterance: ngamsol garangalo ngamawe, nenad gam disol diyawe
unit.utterance_translation: We ran away to the bush after all the mothers had already run away.
They went to the bush.

unit.utterance: ngam sukullo ngammadondo Yapan ngahamam sukullo hontinge
unit.utterance_translation: We were in school and the Japanese closed the school.
I jumped out the window.
I went to the kutur tree area over there.

unit.utterance: lain ilonlomi ngahalange ngawe nenad abedi ngabinge ngawe
unit.utterance_translation: I went into the area and looked for the mothers. (abe di 'look for')
I went to Tibina river.

unit.utterance: ngawe nenad ngaitedindo hage nenad dida ngamsuse
unit.utterance_translation: I went and saw all the mothers and with all the mothers we came down.

unit.utterance: ngamsuse ngammadonge do ngahau sese ai
unit.utterance_translation: We came down and we sat with our grandfarther.
Grandfather Kon.
Grandfather Kon built a house in the jungle
On the side of the river.

unit.utterance: ab yabi hage mana ngammadondo ngamaindo
unit.utterance_translation: He built a house there and we stayed and slept there.
We slept and went around and
the Japanese came to the water.
They chopped up our canoes
They cut the canoes in half,
and we went down and looked at the canoes,
and we carried the canoes on top.

unit.utterance: ngamsap aigite wai ngamhatep neb ngamngalep ngamanindo
unit.utterance_translation: We wanted to cross the river and get breadfruit to eat.
No, the canoes were already broken.
The Japanese broke them.
The Japanese came.
Later more Japanese came again.
They came, we went down to the house, we stayed,

unit.utterance: Yapan dipalume ab balente hadi roksak milo didirisinge mone
unit.utterance_translation: the Japanese came and put down their backpacks on the veranda of the house.
They put them.
And our pigs,
they cut their necks.
They ate them.
They ate.
And we went down and we ran away.

unit.utterance: Yapan gam malal dingalendo ti ngamsole
unit.utterance_translation: The Japanese captured the village and we ran away
And we went to the jungle

unit.utterance: garangalo ngamawe ngahau sese ab yabikaman mainte ngammadonge
unit.utterance_translation: RC: We went to the jungle and stayed with my grandfather who had built the house
and the Japanese stayed at the village
we slept in the jungle
we went around
we didn't come down (to the village)
We stayed there (a long time) and the war finished.
The war finished and all of the Japanese left.

unit.utterance: balus malalte pane ngam yau kas ngamnagendo
unit.utterance_translation: A plane shot warining shot and we made a fire.
We made a fire and then a submarine
was in the water and it shot down (to the beach)

unit.utterance: pansima aria ngahamam milo milo pane, pan susuni yawalago
unit.utterance_translation: It shot down, ok it shot our things, it broke them, it went away.
The submarine shot.

unit.utterance: do mana ngammadonge Yapan diyawaldo hage
unit.utterance_translation: And there we stayed, the Japanese then left completely.
The government came.
The government came and sang out.
It said "Our people, you come up"

unit.utterance: do kako ngale palume staten mon duwelo
unit.utterance_translation: And it brought kargo to Duwe station
At the big ship there, pontoon

unit.utterance: ngale palume mo ngammanemam kaikai ngale palume
unit.utterance_translation: it brought there, it brought food for us.
it brought food and put it there
and then we went and got it
We got food from the submarine
We brought it from there
finished and
They put the pontoon at Duwe station
We used to go get our share from this place.
We took the food, ate it, stayed
and the war finished.
The war finished, they held it and then
We were so so happy
During the time of the Japanese occupation
we got married
we got our breasts, we went around in the jungle and our breasts developed.
oh ah
And we went up to the village and
they were afraid the Japanese wanted them
OK, they gave us to men (made us get married)

unit.utterance: tamat dipanamame hamam lida, lulwai, lulwai tultul tamat dipanamame
unit.utterance_translation: Our leaders gave us to husband, our leaders gave us to husbands (tultul <- tok pisin)
"If not, the Japanese will take you and go to Japan"
they said and gave us to men.
And we stayed

unit.utterance: mon rai kosa tamat ta warlo tordo ilo girek ngalenge
unit.utterance_translation: There, on the Rai Coast, one man went around during the war and got some ideas
It's Yali.

unit.utterance: Yali war lo tordo ilo girek ngalenge
unit.utterance_translation: Yali went around in the war and got some ideas.
OK, he called and we went.
We went, we went to the Rai Coast.
We went and we stayed there.
He told stories.

unit.utterance: war pidago mainwaimi "war tie" i ba
unit.utterance_translation: War came down, and so "the war is finished" he said.
"I saw the war finish and I came"

unit.utterance: "malalte amado " i baldo malalte ab dibinge
unit.utterance_translation: "You stay at the village" he said and they built houses in the village.

unit.utterance: do ngahamam ebong em olsem ngahamam dabokong
unit.utterance_translation: And our, (he became) like our leader
OK we stayed there.

unit.utterance: malalte ngamsuse ab dibinge main ab dibinge
unit.utterance_translation: We went to the village and built houses, built houses
And this village
Yali came there and he stayed.
We put flowers in lines at the village
We (made) the path, the path going to the toilets.
Only flowers, only flowers went
And the borders of the village
(got) flowers (called) rig
We planted them

unit.utterance: malal gigin lang wai dub wai
unit.utterance_translation: Along the border of the village, along the area down below
And we stayed
Our graves there

unit.utterance: main Yali tulinge "matmat nal hudungan agali" i bale
unit.utterance_translation: Yali said "clean the graves every day" he said
And we cleaned (weeded)
We put lines of flowers at the graves
And on Saturdays we went to the graves

unit.utterance: ngam aipainim matmatte ngama plaua ngamdiringgo tamat garmadite garmadite
unit.utterance_translation: We girls went to the graves and put flowers at the heads of the men

unit.utterance: main sarere dope dope ubo dope ngama lottugo
unit.utterance_translation: This was Saturday and on Sunday we went to church

unit.utterance: main malaltenen lulwai tultul, dokta main urat main diyamatenggokai
unit.utterance_translation: The leaders and doctors of the village looked after this work
If it wasn't done, they punished us.
They gave us sand and we carried it.
Yes, at the village the war finished.
Yali came.
OK, this is finished and we stayed
We came (back) altogether to the village.
